organization.description: Datasets to be imported to the OpenSpending.org site. Packages listed here will automatically be available for selection in the OpenSpending web importer.
organization.title: OpenSpending
organization.name: openspending

name: olympics-delivery-authority-spending
notes:
The Olympic Delivery Authority (ODA) is the statutory corporation responsible for ensuring delivery of venues, infrastructure and legacy for the 2012 Summer Olympic and Paralympic Games in London. This dataset consolidates expenditure data for the ODA released from March 2010 onwards as part of the UK government's transparency and open data commitments.

### Data

Source from http://data.gov.uk. See specifically this query: http://catalogue.data.gov.uk/dataset?q=olympics

A consolidated expenditure file pulling together all this data into one is in progress. In the mean time here are links to the original datasets on http://data.gov.uk/:

* [Spending dataset for April 2010 to January 2012 on Data.Gov.UK] (http://data.gov.uk/dataset/financial-transactions-data-oda)
* [Spending dataset for Jan 2011 from Data.Gov.UK](http://data.gov.uk/dataset/oda-transparency-report-january-2011) - strange since a Jan 2011 data file is listed in the previous dataset to
* [Spending dataset for March 2012 from Data.Gov.UK](http://data.gov.uk/dataset/olympic-delivery-authority-transparency-report) - no dataset for Feb 2012 or April 2012 as yet
* [Organogram and staff pay for Olympic Delivery Authority on Data.Gov.UK](http://data.gov.uk/dataset/staff-organograms-and-pay-olympic-delivery-authority)
title: Olympics Delivery Authority (ODA) Spending
